Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Full coverage of all tuition expenses.
A monthly stipend of approximately 16,000 Baht is provided to support living and housing expenses.
Return flights in economy class are covered. The amount of reimbursement for flights may vary based on the applicant’s home location.
Comprehensive health insurance coverage is included.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Open to international students from ASEAN and Non-ASEAN countries, encompassing applicants from all around the world and all nationalities (including ASEAN nations, other regions of Asia, Europe, Africa, Australia, and beyond).
Candidates must fulfill academic requirements and possess an excellent academic record.
No application fee required.
Students who have been studying in any program at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester are not eligible to apply for this specific scholarship.
Eligible_Fields: All fields
Experience_Years: At least 3 years of work experience in any field. Waiver option available for less than 3 years.
Language_Certificate: Strong command of English demonstrated via a certificate of English proficiency from prior university OR standardized English language tests (TOEFL, IELTS).
Special_Circumstances: The scholarship term cannot be extended beyond the initial awarded period.
Other_Requirements: No specific requirements regarding reference letters. Applicants are advised to consult specific faculty/program requirements for any additional documentation or criteria. No application fee.
Scholarship_Info: Chulalongkorn University, Thailand’s oldest and most prestigious university, offers a fully funded Graduate Scholarship Program for international students, demonstrating its commitment to international academic collaboration and providing comprehensive financial support for Master's and Doctoral studies.
Application_Documents: Completed application form and all relevant supporting documents.
Timeline: 2025-10-31 : Application Deadline

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
This is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship. The scholarship provides comprehensive financial support, which explicitly includes:
*   Economy class air-ticket to Brunei Darussalam from the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/country of domicile prior to the commencement of the course.
*   Economy class air-ticket from Brunei Darussalam to the scholarship recipient’s country of origin/country of domicile upon completion of the course.
*   Baggage allowance for shipment of the scholarship recipient's personal effects to their country of origin/country of domicile upon completion of the program, at a maximum amount of BND$250.00 for countries within the ASEAN region. (Specific amounts for non-ASEAN regions are not detailed in the provided evidence).
*   As a "fully funded" scholarship, it is generally understood to cover tuition fees, accommodation, monthly stipends, and book allowances, although these specific components are not itemized in the provided evidence.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international/foreign students, including those from OIC Member States. Applicants must be seeking to pursue Diploma, Undergraduate Degree, or Postgraduate Master’s Degree programs. Age limits: For Undergraduate and Diploma programmes, applicants must not exceed 25 years old. For Postgraduate Master's programmes, applicants must not exceed 35 years old.
Eligible_Fields: All fields
Experience_Years: Not required
Language_Certificate: English proficiency test required (specific tests not detailed)
Special_Circumstances: Not detailed
Other_Requirements:
*   Post-Completion Departure: Scholarship recipients are required to leave Brunei Darussalam with immediate effect upon completion of their program.
*   Employment Restriction: Recipients are not permitted to undertake any paid employment or to serve on the staff of any country’s representative mission in Brunei Darussalam during the duration of the scholarship.
*   Insurance: Scholarship recipients are strongly urged to obtain additional insurance prior to their travel to Brunei Darussalam and for the entire duration of the scholarship, at their own expense.
*   Compliance: Recipients must conform to all the rules and regulations underlying this scholarship award scheme.
*   UBD Specific Application: Applicants interested in Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD) must also complete a separate online application through UBD's admission portal in addition to the scholarship application.
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Brunei Darussalam Scholarship for Foreign Students (BDGS) is a highly regarded, fully funded scholarship offered annually. It provides a unique opportunity for international students to pursue various academic programs at the Diploma, Undergraduate, and Postgraduate Master’s Degree levels at Brunei's leading higher education institutions. The scholarship is a key initiative by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to foster international academic exchange.
Application_Documents: Not detailed
Timeline: 2025/2026 : Academic Session, 2024-02-15 : Application Deadline for 2025/2026 academic session

Scholarship_Name: Government of Ireland – International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend
Funding_Details:
- A €10,000 stipend is provided for one year of full-time study, intended to support student costs and living expenses. This stipend is typically disbursed monthly.
- Successful applicants receive a full tuition fee waiver from their host Irish higher education institution.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be international students with a domiciliary of origin outside the European Union (EU), European Economic Area (EEA), UK, or Switzerland. Candidates must possess a conditional or final offer of admission to an eligible Irish higher education institution for a full-time, international, fee-paying postgraduate program at NFQ levels 9 or 10 (Master's, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD degrees). Applicants who have previously held a GOI-IES scholarship are not eligible to apply again. Successful candidates are expected to demonstrate outstanding academic excellence, strong leadership potential, and a clear commitment to global engagement.
Eligible_Fields: All fields
Experience_Years: Not specified, but prior experience is a primary assessment criterion.
Language_Certificate: Not a direct scholarship requirement; required for university admission.
Other_Requirements: Mandatory reference letters (HEA provides 'Guidance for Referees'), a compelling personal statement, demonstration of leadership potential, and a commitment to global engagement. Application quality is crucial.
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Ireland – International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES) is a prestigious and flagship scholarship program provided by the Government of Ireland in partnership with Irish higher education institutions (HEIs). Managed by the Irish Higher Education Authority (HEA), this initiative is designed to attract outstanding international students to pursue postgraduate studies in Ireland. It reflects Ireland's commitment to international education.
Application_Documents: Essential documents available on HEA website: 2025 Call document, FAQs, Selection Process Infographic, Guidance for Referees, Application Help Document, indicative application form.
Timeline:
Prior to scholarship application : Secure conditional or final offer of admission from an eligible Irish higher education institution.
Currently open : 2025 call for applications for the 2025/2026 academic year.
2025-03-05 : Application Deadline for the 2025/2026 academic year.

Scholarship_Name: Danish Government Scholarship (University of Southern Denmark – SDU)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend
Funding_Details:
The scholarship typically covers full tuition fees and provides a monthly or sizeable living stipend. This comprehensive support allows students to focus fully on their studies without financial burden.
Covered Expenses:
*   Full tuition fees
*   Monthly stipend for living expenses
Important Note on Funding Variation: While generally fully funded, one source indicates that the scholarship may also be granted as partial tuition fee waivers. In such cases, it covers tuition for one year (specifically the second and fourth semesters), requiring the student to pay tuition for the first and third semesters. Applicants should verify the specific terms of their award upon offer.
Eligibility_Criteria: Must be a non-EU/EEA citizen. Must be an international student eligible to pay tuition fees in Denmark. Must be a highly qualified applicant. Applicants must not have previously received a Danish Government Scholarship or a similar funding award from a Danish university. Applicants who are eligible to receive the Danish State Grant cannot be considered for this scholarship.
Eligible_Fields: Engineering programs
Experience_Years: Not required
Language_Certificate: IELTS: A score of 6.5 or higher. TOEFL: A score of 575 (Paper-Based Test - PBT), 230 (Computer-Based Test - CBT), or 88 (Internet-Based Test - iBT).
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements: For Exchange/Guest Students: Exchange or guest students at the Master's level must have completed courses equivalent to 180 ECTS credits (three years of studies) at the university level to be considered. Campus Restrictions: Eligible Engineering Master's programs must be offered either on SDU's new campus in Vejle or at the Sønderborg campus. Application Process: A separate scholarship application is generally not required. Eligible students are automatically considered for the scholarship once they have been admitted to an eligible Master’s program at SDU. Applicants must first complete and submit the online admission application for their chosen Master’s program through the SDU portal. Application Submission: Incomplete or late applications for university admission will not be eligible for scholarship consideration.
Scholarship_Info: The Danish Government Scholarship, specifically offered at the University of Southern Denmark (SDU), is a prestigious funding opportunity for international students. Provided by the Danish Government through the Ministry of Higher Education and Science, this scholarship aims to attract top talent from around the world to pursue Master's degrees in Denmark. It recognizes the significant investment international students make in their education and offers an exceptional opportunity to study in a dynamic and world-class academic environment. The University of Southern Denmark is a public institution renowned for its high-quality education and research, welcoming students globally.
Application_Documents: Online admission application for an eligible Master’s program at SDU.
Timeline:
Currently open : Applications for 2026 scholarship intake
2024-10-15 : Application Deadline for 2024-2025 intake (past deadline for current cycle)
2025-10-15 : Application Deadline for February 2026 intake
2026-02-01 : Application Deadline for September 2026 intake

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Partial Funding, Tuition Waiver, Stipend
Funding_Details:
For Master's students, tuition fees are covered up to CNY 30,000 per academic year. Another source indicates a general scholarship amount of CNY 10,000 for Master's degrees.
A monthly living stipend of up to CNY 2,000 is provided to scholarship recipients.
For postgraduate students, a partial scholarship of CNY 20,000 per academic year has been noted.
The scholarship explicitly covers tuition fees and provides a monthly stipend for living expenses.
Eligibility_Criteria: Must be a non-Chinese citizen (international student). Must be in good health, both mentally and physically. Open to both prospective applicants intending to enroll in a higher education institution in Tianjin and current international students already enrolled at a university in Tianjin. Generally aimed at foreign self-funded undergraduate, postgraduate, and PhD students who are normally enrolled or wish to enroll in Tianjin. Applicants must apply to Higher Education Institutions in Tianjin that are eligible to enroll international students.
Eligible_Fields: All fields
Experience_Years: Not required
Language_Certificate: For Chinese-instructed programs: HSK-5 certificate with a minimum score of 180. For English-instructed programs: English Proficiency Certificates (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL, or other recognized proofs). Applicants must meet the specific language requirements of their chosen higher education institution and provide relevant proofs.
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Career_Plan: Required as part of Personal Statement/Study Plan
Other_Requirements: Two recommendation letters from professors or associate professors are required. A comprehensive Personal Statement is mandatory, which should include a study or research plan, personal background, financial situation, and personal strengths. For Master's and Doctoral degree applicants, this statement must be no less than 800 words, written in Chinese or English.
Scholarship_Info: The Tianjin Government Scholarship (TGS) offers a significant opportunity for international students to pursue Master's degrees in China, specifically within higher education institutions in Tianjin. Provided by the Tianjin Government, this scholarship aims to attract talented non-Chinese citizens to study in one of China's rapidly growing cities, fostering professional skill development and cultural immersion. The scholarship is typically a one-year award, renewable annually, and can offer full or partial financial support.
Application_Documents:
- Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form.
- Personal Statement (including study/research plan, personal background, financial situation, personal strengths, etc., no less than 800 words for Master's/Doctoral degrees, in Chinese or English).
- HSK-5 certificate (minimum score 180) for Chinese-instructed programs, or English Proficiency Certificate for English-instructed programs.
- Bachelor degree diploma.
- Two recommendation letters from professors or associate professors.
- Note: After admission, students will need to present their personal and ordinary passport, Certificate of Admission, Visa Application Form (JW202/JW201), and original Form of Physical Examination Record for Foreigners (along with other original physical examination documents) to the Chinese Embassy or Consulate to apply for an X1 student visa.
Timeline:
October 15, 2024 : Applications typically open for Tianjin University
May 31, 2025 : Application Deadline for Tianjin University (Bachelor and Master programs)
June 30, 2025 : Application Deadline for Tianjin Normal University
July 1 - August 31 : Tianjin University announces admission results and dispatches official documents
One week before submission to Tianjin Municipal Education Commission : Assessment results publicized

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Full coverage of tuition fees for the entire duration of the study program.
A monthly stipend is provided to cover living costs.
Scholarship holders are entitled to either dormitory placement or a monthly contribution of HUF 40,000 towards accommodation costs.
For programs taught in Hungarian, language proficiency is not mandatory as the scholarship includes a preparatory Hungarian language year.
The program offers dual education opportunities, allowing students to gain practical experience through internships. Scholarship holders are entitled and often required to participate in an internship as a prerequisite for their last semester.
Quantity: The number of scholarships available varies by country. For example, 200 scholarships have been announced for eligible Kenyans for the 2026/2027 academic year.
Eligibility_Criteria: The scholarship is specifically for foreign students. A critical eligibility requirement is that applicants are only eligible to apply for scholarship types and study fields that are determined in the educational cooperation programs in effect between Hungary and their specific sending partner (Ministry of Education or national scholarship office/agency) in their home country. Applicants must ensure their selected program is eligible under this agreement. The scientific fields, level of education, and number of applicants vary by country. Applicants are advised to inquire about possible programs directly with their country of origin's sending partner.
Eligible_Fields: All fields
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: Not required
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly stated as a mandatory application requirement; preparatory Hungarian language year provided for Hungarian-taught programs.
Special_Circumstances: Includes a "Students at Risk Subprogramme."
Other_Requirements: Applicants must submit all required documents as specified in the Call for Applications. Scholarship holders are required to comply with the Stipendium Hungaricum Programme Operational Regulations, including academic progress requirements. Applicants and current students are encouraged to regularly review the "Rights and Obligations" and "Scholarship Agreement" documents, as updates may affect scholarship terms.
Scholarship_Info: The Stipendium Hungaricum Scholarship Programme is a fully funded opportunity launched by the Hungarian Government in 2013. Managed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade and coordinated by Tempus Public Foundation, it aims to attract top foreign students to study in Hungary. The scholarship supports Bachelor's, Master's, One-Tier Master's, and PhD programs across over 800 full-degree programs in more than 30 Hungarian universities.
Application_Documents: Applicants must submit their completed online application and required documents through the Tempus Public Foundation portal. In addition to the Stipendium Hungaricum online application, applicants may also be required to complete and submit a country-specific scholarship application through their home country's Department of Education or equivalent body (e.g., Government of Saint Lucia Scholarship Application). Applicants must submit all required documents as specified in the Call for Applications.
Timeline:
January - February : Online application submission period
2026-01-15 : Online registration deadline (12 noon, 2 p.m. Central European Time, and 9 a.m. Atlantic Standard Time (Saint Lucia))
Results notification : By home country's ministry of education or national scholarship office/agency

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Scholarship recipients receive monthly stipends. The general scholarship amount is €8,000 per year. A specific program, "ITALYOU – Italy in your future," offers 70 annual scholarships of €6,250 each, disbursed over 12 monthly installments.
Covered Expenses:
*   Health and Medical/Accident Insurance contracted by MAECI.
*   University Tuition Fees (generally exempt).
*   Monthly Stipends.
*   Exceptions for Language Courses: tuition and enrollment fees are required and are not covered by the exemption.
*   Mandatory Fees: Students are responsible for covering a regional tax of €140 and a stamp duty of €16.
Quantity: For the third edition of the "ITALYOU" program (a.y. 2025-2026), MAECI will award 70 new annual scholarships specifically to students from Algeria, Cameroon, Egypt, Libya, Morocco, Senegal, and Tunisia. The total number of scholarships awarded each year varies and is not universally specified.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students, foreign students residing abroad, and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Applicants must hold an appropriate academic qualification required to enroll in the chosen Italian University or Institute.
Eligible_Fields: Master’s Degree Programs, PhD Programs, Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) Programs, Italian Language and Culture Courses, Research/Training Programs, "ItAS – Italian for Teaching to Foreigners" Master’s degree program
Eligible_Field_Group: Education & Training, Arts, Design & Media, Humanities & Social Sciences
Experience_Years: Not required
Language_Certificate: Italian-Taught Programs (Bachelor's, Master's, AFAM): B2 level proficiency in Italian (CEFR). English-Taught Programs (Bachelor's, Master's, AFAM): B2 level proficiency in English. Italian Language and Culture Advanced Courses: A minimum A2 level proficiency in Italian (CEFR).
Age: Master’s Degree, AFAM Programs, Italian Language and Culture Advanced Courses: at least 18 years old and shall not exceed the age of 28 by the call's deadline (e.g., born after May 16th, 1996 for 2025-2026). PhD Programs: meet entry requirements and academic qualifications established by the specific university. Exception for renewals of existing scholarships.
Special_Circumstances: Open to Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Specific program "ITALYOU" for students from Algeria, Cameroon, Egypt, Libya, Morocco, Senegal, and Tunisia.
Other_Requirements: PhD applicants are required to provide a letter of acceptance from the relevant Italian University. Applicants are responsible for undertaking their own research into programs and institutions to ensure their qualifications will be recognized. The MAECI grant is incompatible with any other grant offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution, including DSU grants. Scholarships can be renewed for the following academic year, provided students meet specific performance requirements.
Scholarship_Info: The Italian Government Scholarship, officially known as the MAECI Scholarship, is an esteemed initiative provided by the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI). This scholarship program is designed to support international students, foreign students residing abroad, and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE) in pursuing higher education, research, and training programs in Italy. Its primary goals are to promote cultural exchange, strengthen academic cooperation, support Italy's economic system globally, and foster the Italian language and culture. It offers a unique opportunity for international students to immerse themselves in Italy's rich academic and cultural heritage, fostering global talent and international understanding.
Application_Documents:
*   Academic credentials.
*   Certificate proving proficiency in the Italian language (if applicable).
*   Certificate proving proficiency in the English language (if applicable).
*   Letter of acceptance from the Italian University (for PhD programs).
Timeline:
April 2025 : Applications for the 2025-2026 academic year opened.
May 2025 : Application deadline for the 2025-2026 academic year (typically, precise universal deadline not explicitly stated).
November 1st, 2025, to July 31st, 2026 : 9-month scholarships available (renewable).
January 1st to September 30th, 2026 : 3-month scholarships available (exclusively for advanced courses in Italian language and culture).

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Türkiye Scholarships is a fully funded, government-backed program that comprehensively covers various expenses for its awardees. The scholarship ensures that students can focus on their studies without financial burden.

Covered Expenses Include:
*   Tuition Fees: Full coverage of all university tuition fees.
*   Monthly Stipend: A monthly stipend is provided to cover living expenses. This stipend is approximately 6,500 TL.
*   Health Insurance: All scholarship students are covered by general health insurance, allowing them to benefit from widespread health services in emergencies or other situations.
*   Turkish Language Course: Awardees who do not possess a C1 Level Turkish Proficiency Certificate are required to attend a mandatory 1-year Turkish Language Course. This course is fully covered by the scholarship, and students must attain the C1 Level Certificate by the end of their academic year, even if they are placed into English or other language medium programs.
Quantity: Approximately 5,000 new scholarships are awarded each year.
Eligibility_Criteria: Students from all countries are eligible to apply. Individuals currently enrolled in programs at Turkish universities at the same level of education they are applying for are ineligible. This also applies to joint scholarship programs. For Associate and Bachelor's Degree Candidates: A minimum academic achievement of 70%. For Graduate Candidates (Master's and PhD): A minimum academic achievement of 75%. For Master’s Programs: Under the age of 30. For PhD Programs: Under the age of 35. For Research Scholarship: Under the age of 50.
Eligible_Fields: Engineering, Social Sciences, Health Sciences, Basic Sciences, Humanities, Natural Sciences, Agriculture, Life Science and Environment, Information, Medicine, Performing Arts, Music, Fine Arts
Eligible_Field_Group: Engineering & Technology, Humanities & Social Sciences, Healthcare & Medicine, Natural Sciences, Agriculture & Environment, IT & Data Science, Arts, Design & Media
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: Not required
Language_Certificate: C1 Level Turkish Proficiency Certificate (if not, mandatory 1-year Turkish Language Course); International language test results (e.g., TOEFL, DELF) if specified by university/program for English/other language medium programs.
Age: Master's: Under 30, PhD: Under 35, Research: Under 50
Special_Circumstances: Individuals currently enrolled in programs at Turkish universities at the same level of education they are applying for are ineligible. This also applies to joint scholarship programs.
Other_Requirements: At least one recommendation letter is required. A valid identification card or passport. A recent passport photo. International exam results such as GRE, GMAT, SAT, etc., are required if specified by the chosen university or program (most English or other language medium programs require these).
Scholarship_Info: The Türkiye Scholarships, officially known as Türkiye Bursları, is a prestigious international scholarship program funded by the Government of Turkey. It is designed to attract outstanding international students to pursue higher education in Türkiye. As the largest Turkish scholarship program for international students, it aims to strengthen educational and cultural ties between Türkiye and other countries by offering a unique educational experience at some of the nation's most esteemed universities.
Application_Documents:
A valid identification card or passport.
A recent passport photo.
International exam results (if required).
International language test results (if required).
Recommendation letter(s).
Timeline:
Annually on January 10th : Application Opening Date
Annually between January 10th and February 20th : Application Deadline
April to June : Interview Process for shortlisted candidates

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend
Funding_Details:
The scholarship includes a substantial grant and a full tuition fee waiver per academic year.
*   A grant of €10,020 per academic year (for 60 ECTS).
*   A full tuition fee waiver. Scholarship holders are typically only required to pay a reduced administrative fee.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be outstanding international students from any country worldwide. The previous degree (used to enroll for the master program) cannot have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution. International students who have previously been enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution on credit mobility (such as Erasmus+) are still eligible. However, students who are already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution for a full degree program are not eligible to apply.
Eligible_Fields: All fields
Experience_Years: Not required
Language_Certificate: IELTS: 7.0; TOEFL: 94; Common European Framework: C1 level
Other_Requirements: Candidates must apply for and be accepted into an eligible master's degree program at a Flemish host higher education institution in Flanders or Brussels. Acceptance by the host institution for a degree program is mandatory to receive the scholarship. Preparatory programs are not eligible. Distance learning programs are not eligible. Students enrolled in certain unspecified programs for the 2025-2026 academic year are also not eligible. The Master Mind Scholarship cannot be combined with any other scholarship from the Flemish Government.
Scholarship_Info: The Master Mind Scholarship, provided by the Government of Flanders and the Flemish Ministry of Education and Training, is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program designed for outstanding international students worldwide. It offers an exceptional opportunity to pursue a master's degree in Flanders and Brussels, Belgium. The scholarship aims to attract top talent to Flemish higher education institutions, fostering international academic exchange and excellence.
Application_Documents:
Master Mind Scholarship Application Form (mandatory)
Required academic documents (transcripts, diplomas)
Proof of English language proficiency (IELTS, TOEFL, or C1 certificate)
Letter of motivation (highly recommended)
KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form (if applying to KU Leuven)
Proof of admission to a master's program (required to receive the scholarship)
Timeline:
Applications for the 2026-2027 academic year are currently open.
2026-01-15 : Primary application deadline for submitting a complete application file for an eligible master’s program and expressing interest in the scholarship (deadline by which host institutions typically nominate candidates).

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Stipend, Comprehensive Medical Insurance, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
*   **Tuition Waiver:** Fully funded by the host university, covering education, administration, and health insurance costs.
*   **Accommodation:** Provision of free university dormitory or equivalent housing.
*   **Stipend:** A living allowance to cover daily expenses.
*   **Comprehensive Medical Insurance:** Coverage for medical needs throughout the study period.
*   **Other Costs:** May also cover expenditures to support student activities.

While the scholarship is generally comprehensive, some specific programs or channels may have additional details. For instance, the AASCU-designated CGS is valued at approximately $10,000 USD, disbursed directly to the Chinese universities rather than individual students. The Bahamas Embassy also highlights four full scholarships covering tuition fees, accommodation, living expenses, and medical insurance. If a study plan extends beyond the academic year 2026/2027, the host university is typically responsible for covering the exceeded period.
Quantity: In 2021, 59 Pakistani students were awarded the CGS. Great Wall Program: up to two candidates per member country (at least one female). Bahamas Embassy: four full scholarships for the 2026/2027 academic year.
Eligibility_Criteria: Must be non-Chinese citizens and in good health. Specific nationality requirements apply to certain programs; for example, the "Silk Road" program is for nationals of countries belonging to the 'One Belt One Road' initiative, while the "Chinese Universities-Postgraduate Program" is open to all nationalities. Dual nationality holders are generally not eligible (e.g., for Pakistani/AJ&K nationals). US citizens, South African students, and Ghanaian students are also specifically mentioned as eligible for certain channels. Applicants must not have completed their previous study within China, or at least one year must have passed since they completed any prior study in China. Applicants must be at least 18 years old by the application date. Undergraduate applicants: Under the age of 25. Master's applicants: Under the age of 35. Doctoral applicants: Under the age of 40. General Scholars: Under the age of 35. For programs like the "Great Wall Program," each member country's nomination must include at least one female candidate.
Eligible_Fields: All fields
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Min_Gpa: 2.7/4.0 (for some specific university channels, e.g., University of Houston)
Experience_Years: Not required
Language_Certificate: Applicants for Chinese-taught master's, doctoral, general scholar, and senior scholar programs must submit a valid HSK score report that meets the corresponding Chinese language proficiency requirements. For "Silk Road" program applicants: Bachelor’s applicants for Chinese-taught programs need HSK 3 (minimum 180 points). Master’s and PhD applicants for Chinese-taught programs need HSK 4 (minimum 180 points). The UIBE High Level Postgraduate Program also requires a minimum of 180 points for HSK. Applicants who meet the minimum HSK score but do not meet the direct major entry language requirements may be granted one year of Chinese Language study.
Age: At least 18 years old by application date. Undergraduate applicants: Under 25. Master's applicants: Under 35. Doctoral applicants: Under 40. General Scholars: Under 35.
Gender: Great Wall Program: at least one female candidate per country nomination; otherwise, no requirement.
Special_Circumstances: Dual nationality holders are generally not eligible (e.g., for Pakistani/AJ&K nationals). Applicants must not have completed their previous study within China, or at least one year must have passed since they completed any prior study in China.
Career_Plan: Successful applicants from certain countries (e.g., South Africa) may be required to sign a contract committing to return to their home country upon completing their studies.
Other_Requirements: Applicants for graduate programs or senior scholar programs must submit two letters of recommendation, written in Chinese or English, from professors or associate professors. A research proposal is required for postgraduate studies. Applicants for postgraduate studies must submit any admission documents they have received from Chinese universities. Applicants must be in good health.
Scholarship_Info: The Chinese Government Scholarship (CGS) is a prestigious scholarship program provided by the Chinese Government and administered by the China Scholarship Council (CSC). It aims to sponsor international students, scholars, and non-degree language students to study or conduct research in China. The scholarship is managed through various channels, including Chinese Embassies/Consulates and partner institutions. The program supports short-term or long-term study at a wide network of designated Chinese universities, currently numbering 274 institutions.
Application_Documents:
*   Completed online Application Form for Chinese Government Scholarship.
*   A copy of the submitted online application and an English version of the application form (for some channels like Ireland).
*   Degree certificates (for Master's or PhD applicants).
*   Academic transcripts.
*   Research proposal (for postgraduate studies).
*   Admission documents from Chinese universities (if available).
*   Valid HSK score report (for Chinese-taught programs).
*   Two letters of recommendation.
*   A valid ordinary passport.
*   Foreigner Physical Examination Form.
*   Visa Application for Study In China (JW201) and Admission Notice (required for visa application after acceptance).
Timeline:
2025-01-04 : US Embassy announces opening for Academic Year 2026/2027
2025-11-30 : CSC submission via the Ghana Scholarships Secretariat
2026-02-08 : General deadline for online application submission to the Chinese Government Scholarship Information System (CGSIS) at www.campuschina.org
2026-02-25 : Email submission of online application copies and supporting documents to Ireland's Department of Further and Higher Education, Research Innovation and Science (5 PM)
2026-02-28 : Email submission of the ZJU Application Form for "Youth of Excellence Scheme of China Program" at Zhejiang University

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Tuition fees (waived for the entire duration of studies).
Monthly stipends (living expenses).
Subsidized accommodation in student dormitories.
A mandatory preparatory year for learning the Romanian language (for Bachelor's and Master's students).
Medical assistance in case of emergencies.
Local public transport discounts.
Quantity: 500 scholarships are granted by the Government of Romania to foreign students from five continents.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open exclusively to foreign citizens from non-EU countries. Citizens of European Union countries are not eligible. Applicants must not have previously received a Romanian Government scholarship for the same level of study. Candidates must demonstrate good academic results, with an average of the study years for the last graduated school of at least 7 (seven) corresponding to the scoring system in Romania, or the "Good" score. For example, a 3.77/4.00 GPA can convert to approximately 9.42 on the Romanian scale.
Eligible_Fields: All fields available in accredited Romanian higher education institutions, excluding Medicine, Dental Medicine, and Pharmacy.
Eligible_Field_Group: Education & Training, Arts, Design & Media, Humanities & Social Sciences, Economics & Business, Law & Public Policy, Natural Sciences, IT & Data Science, Engineering & Technology, Construction & Planning, Agriculture & Environment, Social Services & Care, Personal Services & Tourism, Security & Defense, Library & Information Management, Transportation & Logistics
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Min_Gpa: at least 7 (seven) corresponding to the scoring system in Romania, or the "Good" score. For example, a 3.77/4.00 GPA can convert to approximately 9.42 on the Romanian scale.
Experience_Years: Not required
Language_Certificate: No specific IELTS, TOEFL, or other language certificates are universally required for initial application, as the preparatory year addresses language proficiency for most applicants. However, for PhD candidates opting for a foreign language, the doctoral school may have specific language proficiency requirements.
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements: Citizenship: Open exclusively to foreign citizens from non-EU countries. Citizens of European Union countries are not eligible. Prior Scholarship Status: Applicants must not have previously received a Romanian Government scholarship for the same level of study. Language of Instruction: For Bachelor's and Master's studies, programs are exclusively available in Romanian. For PhD programs, applicants have the option to study in Romanian or another foreign language set by the doctoral school. Preparatory Year: Mandatory for Bachelor's and Master's candidates who do not speak Romanian. Doctoral scholarship holders opting for a foreign language are exempt.
Scholarship_Info: The Romanian Government Scholarship, offered annually through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA), is a fully funded opportunity designed for non-EU citizens to pursue Bachelor's, Master's, and PhD studies in Romania. It aims to promote Romanian higher education, cultural exchange, and deepen bilateral relations.
Application_Documents:
A duly filled in MFA application form for a scholarship to study in Romania.
Cover letter issued by the diplomatic mission.
Motivation letter.
Copy of the certificate proving that the person in the final year of studies is to take the graduation exam at the end of the school/university year (if applicable).
Copy of the transcript attesting to the academic record of the person in the final year of studies, until the moment of submitting the application file (if applicable).
Academic transcripts/diplomas from previously graduated schools/universities.
Letters of recommendation.
Copy of the birth certificate.
Copy of the passport (valid for at least 6 months beyond the intended start of studies).
Medical certificate.
Curriculum Vitae (CV).
Translations: All documents not originally in English, French, Spanish, or Romanian must be accompanied by an authorized translation into one of these languages.
Timeline:
January 29, 2025 : Application Opening Date
March 12, 2025 : Application Deadline
2025-2026 academic year : Program Period

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Fully funded fellowships, providing 100% tuition coverage.
Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition fees
*   Monthly living allowances
*   Research funding
*   Settlement allowance: Awardees receive 6,000 Baht (approximately USD 173.36) upon their first arrival in Thailand.
Eligibility_Criteria: International students from developing countries, primarily targets government officials from developing countries. Candidates must be nominated by their National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation (e.g., Ministry of Foreign Affairs or equivalent body in their home country). Applicants must be citizens of countries/territories listed in the official "List of Eligible Countries/Territories" for the specific intake year. Candidates must fulfill all other relevant qualification requirements.
Eligible_Fields: Sufficiency Economy Philosophy (SEP), Public Health, Agriculture and Food Security, Climate Change and Environmental Issues, Bio-Circular-Green Economy (BCG Model), Other topics related to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)
Eligible_Field_Group: Agriculture & Environment, Engineering & Technology, Healthcare & Medicine, Law & Public Policy, Natural Sciences
Min_Gpa: A GPA of at least 2.75 out of 4.0 or equivalent. Alternatively, a GPA higher than 2.50 or at least a 1st Division in their previous academic qualifications.
Experience_Years: A minimum of 2 years of work experience with the nominating agency at the time of application. Some sources indicate a minimum of 3 years of work experience with the nominating agency at the time of application. Applicants should verify the specific requirement for their intake year.
Language_Certificate: Candidates whose first language is not English and whose Bachelor's degree was not instructed in English are required to pass an English Language proficiency test (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL, or other recognized certificates).
Special_Circumstances: The scholarship is specifically designed for government officials and individuals from other developing countries across the world, aiming to foster international cooperation and capacity building.
Other_Requirements: Applicants are required to submit recommendation letters from three (3) persons. Applicants must ensure they meet all relevant qualification requirements and that their current work aligns with the program's objectives. It is crucial to check the official "List of Eligible Countries/Territories" for each intake.
Scholarship_Info: The Thailand International Postgraduate Programme (TIPP) is a prestigious scholarship initiative provided by the Royal Thai Government through the Thailand International Development Cooperation Agency (TICA). Established in 1999/2000, TIPP offers fully-funded postgraduate scholarships to individuals from developing countries worldwide, primarily at the Master's degree level, to share Thailand's expertise and foster cooperation partnerships, particularly in areas aligned with the UN SDGs and the Sufficiency Economy Philosophy.
Application_Documents:
*   Official Application Form for TIPP
*   Guidelines for TIPP (specific to the intake year)
*   List of Eligible Countries/Territories
*   Recommendation letters from three persons
Timeline:
2025-01-30 (by 5 PM) : Submission of application forms to the respective Ministry for onward transmission.
2025-01-31 : Submission of application forms to the Royal Thai Embassy/Permanent Mission of Thailand to the United Nations/Royal Thai Consulate-General accredited to eligible countries/territories.

Scholarship_Name: National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic (NSP)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details: Fully Funded. Covered Expenses: Living costs during the stay at universities and research organisations; Travel allowances for international students and PhD students; Travel allowances for all categories of scholarship holders from Slovakia. Purpose of Funding: To cover the costs associated with study, research/artistic, or teaching stays.
Quantity: 146 awarded scholarships (75 students, 25 PhD students, 46 university teachers/researchers/artists) in a past call (April 30, 2025 deadline)
Eligibility_Criteria: Eligible Candidates: International students, PhD students, university teachers, researchers, and artists whose higher education or scientific training takes place outside Slovakia. Candidates must be accepted by a Slovak public, private, or state university or a research institution (e.g., the Slovak Academy of Sciences) for an academic mobility stay (study, research, artistic, or teaching). Slovak university students, PhD students, and postdocs for stays outside Slovakia. Exclusions: International students and PhD students accepted for full degree higher education (bachelor, master, doctoral studies) in Slovakia, or those already studying full degree programmes in Slovakia who seek NSP funding for their ongoing studies. University teachers, researchers, and artists without a PhD degree (or its equivalent) who have more than 4 years of work experience as a university teacher/researcher/artist on the application deadline (PhD studies are considered work experience). However, in extraordinary circumstances (force majeure), the administrator may accept candidates without a PhD and with 4-7 years of experience, though they will receive the scholarship amount corresponding to applicants with less than 4 years of experience. International applicants who have spent 15 or more months (in total) in the territory of the Slovak Republic within the 36 months prior to the application deadline. International applicants who are simultaneously accepted for a scholarship stay in Slovakia under other scholarship programmes funded from public resources (e.g., International Visegrad Fund, Erasmus+, CEEPUS, bilateral agreements).
Eligible_Fields: All fields
Experience_Years: Varies by category: < 4 years for young researchers, > 4 years for PhD holders, > 10 years for senior researchers. PhD studies count as experience. Exceptions up to 7 years for non-PhD holders in force majeure.
Language_Certificate: Documents must be in Slovak or English; official translations required for other languages (unofficial may be temporarily accepted under force majeure).
Special_Circumstances: Exceptions for experience requirements or unofficial translations may be made in cases of force majeure, subject to Selection Committee review and later submission of official documents.
Career_Plan: Detailed teaching and/or research/artistic programme required for PhD students, university teachers, researchers, and artists.
Other_Requirements: International applicants who have spent 15 or more months (in total) in Slovakia within 36 months prior to the application deadline are ineligible.
Scholarship_Info: The National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic (NSP) is a prestigious mobility scholarship established in 2005 by the Government of the Slovak Republic to foster international academic and artistic mobility, supporting short-term stays at Slovak higher education and research institutions.
Application_Documents: Online application form. Motivation letter. List of publications/artistic activities (especially for PhD students, researchers, and artists). Detailed teaching and/or research/artistic programme (mandatory for PhD students, university teachers, researchers, and artists). Original documents with official translations into Slovak or English (unofficial translations may be accepted temporarily under force majeure conditions, with official versions required later).
Timeline: Late 2025 : Call for 2026/2027 summer semester announced open. 2026-04-30 : Application Deadline for 2026-2027 academic year program (summer semester).

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The KNB Scholarship is a fully funded program, with all expenses covered by the Indonesian Government. This financial assistance ensures that recipients can focus entirely on their studies and cultural immersion without financial burden.

Covered Expenses and Allowances:
*   Full tuition fees for the duration of the program.
*   Monthly research allowance.
*   Monthly book allowance.
*   Living expenses.
*   Other unspecified expenses related to the study program.

Research and book allowances are provided monthly upon the student's arrival in Indonesia, throughout the scholarship duration, including during the BIPA (Bahasa Indonesia for Foreign Speakers) and academic programs.
Quantity: Approximately 200 scholarships are awarded annually across all levels of study and fields. For instance, the 2021 awards included 25 Doctoral, 218 Master's, and 25 Bachelor's program recipients.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be citizens of a developing country. Applicants cannot register for the scholarship without a recommendation letter from the Indonesian Representative (Embassy or Consulate General) in their country of origin. The scholarship is specifically for applicants from developing countries, aligning with Indonesia’s South–South Partnership initiatives.
Eligible_Fields: Engineering, Economics, Health Sciences, Social Studies, Educational Science Education
Eligible_Field_Group: Engineering & Technology, Economics & Business, Healthcare & Medicine, Humanities & Social Sciences, Education & Training
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: Not specified.
Language_Certificate: An English proficiency test report is required for applicants from non-English-speaking countries.
Age: Maximum 25 years old for Bachelor's degree applicants. Maximum 35 years old for Master's degree applicants. Maximum 40 years old for Doctoral degree applicants.
Special_Circumstances: The scholarship is specifically for applicants from developing countries, aligning with Indonesia’s South–South Partnership initiatives.
Career_Plan: A statement of purpose outlining their studies in Indonesia is required for Doctoral applicants only.
Other_Requirements: Bachelor's Degree Applicants must not already hold a degree.
Scholarship_Info: The Kemitraan Negara Berkembang (KNB) Scholarship is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program offered by the Government of Indonesia. Designed for international students from developing countries, it facilitates the pursuit of Bachelor's, Master's, and Doctoral degrees at 31-34 top Indonesian universities. The scholarship is a key component of Indonesia’s global cooperation efforts, particularly its South–South Partnership initiatives, aiming to foster academic excellence and cultural exchange.
Application_Documents:
Completed online application form.
Recommendation letter from the Indonesian Embassy/Consulate General.
Recommendation letter from an employer/immediate supervisor (if applicable).
Academic Recommendation Letter from previous schools.
Academic Certificates (e.g., High school degree certificate for Bachelor applicants, Bachelor's degree for Master's applicants, Master's degree for Doctoral applicants).
Academic Transcripts from previous degrees.
English proficiency test report (for non-English-speaking countries).
Passport.
Statement of purpose (for Doctoral applicants only).
Recommendation letter from potential research supervisor (for Doctoral applicants only).
Offering Letter (likely from the chosen university, to be submitted later).
Formal Photo.
Curriculum Vitae (CV).
Final Diploma (for embassy review).
Timeline:
2025-02-17 : Application Opening Date
2025-03-07 : Application Deadline
2025-03-03 to 2025-03-21 : Embassy Recommendation Letter Submission Period
2025-07-11 : Immigration Document Submission Deadline
Selection Results : Announced online via the KNB Scholarship Website and officially through the Indonesian Embassy publication network.

Scholarship_Name: Azerbaijan Government Scholarship (Educational Grant for OIC/NAM)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Fully funded scholarship program, providing comprehensive financial support to its beneficiaries.
*   Full tuition fees for the chosen program.
*   Annual round-trip international flights.
*   A monthly allowance of 800 AZN (approximately 470 USD).
*   Comprehensive medical insurance.
*   Visa and registration costs within Azerbaijan.
Eligibility_Criteria:
The scholarship targets international students from specific geopolitical blocs and countries with historical ties to Azerbaijan. A crucial requirement is official nomination by the applicant's home country government.
*   Eligible Countries: Citizens of Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) member states, Non-Aligned Movement (NAM) member states, Small Island Developing States (SIDS), or countries with cultural, ethnic, or historical ties to Azerbaijan.
*   Nomination Requirement: Applicants must be officially nominated by their home country government authorities (e.g., Ministry of Foreign Affairs or Ministry of Education). Only officially nominated candidates will proceed to the second stage of the application process.
Eligible_Fields: High-demand fields such as engineering, public health, international relations, and others.
Eligible_Field_Group: Engineering & Technology, Healthcare & Medicine, Law & Public Policy, Humanities & Social Sciences
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Min_Gpa: 70% (or 7 on a 10-point scale); some sources mention 3.0
Experience_Years: Not required
Language_Certificate:
Proof of proficiency in Azerbaijani or English is necessary, especially if the language of prior education was not English.
*   For Undergraduate Programs: IELTS 5.0 or TOEFL 40.
*   For Postgraduate Programs (Master's/PhD): IELTS 5.5 or TOEFL 50.
Age: Undergraduate/General Medicine: Under 35 years old. Graduate/Medical Residency: Under 40 years old. Doctoral Programs: Under 45 years old (calculated by September 15, 2025).
Special_Circumstances: Undergraduate students are strongly advised against applying for medical-related degree programs in Azerbaijani universities, as these programs are currently not recognized by the Sri Lanka Medical Council (SLMC).
Scholarship_Info: The Heydar Aliyev International Education Grant Program, formerly known as the Scholarship of the Government of the Republic of Azerbaijan, is a prestigious educational grant program for the 2025/2026 academic year. It is funded by the Government of the Republic of Azerbaijan, with administration overseen by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Science and Education. The program was renamed in honor of Heydar Aliyev, the National Leader of Azerbaijan, to support the education of foreigners in Azerbaijani higher education institutions and secure Azerbaijan's position in international relations. The scholarship offers international students the opportunity to pursue higher education in Azerbaijan.
Application_Documents:
*   Completed nomination form (submitted through the applicant's country's Ministry of Foreign Affairs or Education).
*   Academic Recommendation Letter.
*   Academic documents (transcripts/certificates).
*   National ID.
*   Bio-data page of passport (or evidence of processing).
Timeline:
2025-03-15 – 2025-05-15 : Submission of applications (first stage) to the relevant government authorities of the applicant’s country.
2025-05-16 – 2025-05-31 : Review and evaluation of candidates by the respective government authorities.
2025-06-01 – 2025-06-20 : Registration of applications (second stage) in the SIACAS (Study in Azerbaijan Centralized Admission Service).
2025-06-20 – 2025-07-15 : Review and evaluation of candidates by SIACAS.
2025-07-16 – 2025-07-31 : Notification of selected candidates.
2025-09-15 : Start of the academic year.
2025-09-30 : Last date for arrival in the Republic of Azerbaijan.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The Beca Colombia Scholarship is a fully funded, non-refundable financial support program. It provides comprehensive coverage for selected beneficiaries, ensuring a worry-free academic experience.
Covered Expenses Include:
*   Tuition Fees: Full coverage of academic program costs.
*   Health Insurance: Comprehensive health insurance and medical costs.
*   Visa Expenses: Coverage for the necessary visa fees.
*   Living Expenses: Support for daily living costs.
*   Monthly Stipend: A monthly allowance of one million six hundred thousand (1,600,000) Colombian pesos, equivalent to three Colombian legal monthly minimum wages, to cover basic living expenses.
*   Installation Expenses: A one-time grant to assist with initial setup costs.
*   Books and Materials: Financial support for academic books and study materials.
*   Travel Allowance: Assistance with travel-related expenses.
*   Family Allowance: (Specific details not provided, but listed as a covered expense).
*   Rent: (Specific details not provided, but listed as a covered expense).
*   Foreign Identification Card: A one-time grant for the issuance of a foreign identification card.
*   Application Fee: No application fee is required for this scholarship program.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Candidates must meet stringent requirements to qualify for the Beca Colombia Scholarship:
*   Nationality: Must be foreign citizens from any nationality, not holding dual Colombian nationality.
*   Residency: Must not be residing in Colombia, nor have resided in Colombian territory for the last six (6) months prior to applying for the scholarship. Applicants must also not have started postgraduate studies in Colombia at the time of application.
*   Previous Beneficiaries: Must not have been beneficiaries of this program in previous calls.
*   Academic Background: Must possess a professional or bachelor's (undergraduate) degree.
*   University Requirements: Must meet any additional requirements specified by the chosen Colombian university.
*   Age Limit: Applicants should generally be between 25 and 49 years old (not older than 49).
Eligible_Fields: Postgraduate studies (Specialization, Master's, Doctoral degrees, Perfectioning of Spanish) across a variety of academic disciplines.
Min_Gpa: 4.0 on the Colombian scale of 1 to 5
Experience_Years: At least one (1) year of professional experience in their field of study.
Language_Certificate: IELTS or other English language proficiency tests are generally not mandatory. However, applicants may be required to submit IELTS/TOEFL scores or equivalent proof of English proficiency if specifically applicable to their chosen program or university.
Special_Circumstances: Scholarship recipients agree not to request a visa to remain in Colombia for two (2) years from the date the scholarship ends. The program's purpose is to educate foreigners in Colombian institutions, after which recipients must return to their country of origin or residence to apply the acquired knowledge. For academic programs longer than 12 months, scholarship holders must request annual renewal from ICETEX to ensure continuity of their studies.
Other_Requirements: Once selected, a change of academic program or university is strictly not allowed. The scholarship will only consider the academic program and university initially submitted in the application. Must meet any additional requirements specified by the chosen Colombian university.
Scholarship_Info: The Beca Colombia Scholarship Programme for Foreigners is a fully funded initiative by the Colombian government, administered by ICETEX (Colombian Institute of Educational Credit and Technical Studies Abroad). Designed as part of Colombia's Reciprocity Programme, it aims to foster academic, cultural, and technological exchange by offering postgraduate study opportunities (Specialization, Master's, Doctoral degrees, and Perfectioning of Spanish) to international students in Colombian higher education institutions. The scholarship covers a wide array of expenses, including tuition, living costs, health insurance, and visa fees, making it a comprehensive support system for high-achieving foreign citizens. The Beca Colombia Scholarship Programme is a key component of Colombia’s Reciprocity Programme. It is designed to promote academic, cultural, and technological exchange, strengthening social ties between international students and Colombian institutions.
Application_Documents:
Required documents are detailed in the official call for applications. These typically include:
*   Verified copies of Educational Transcripts.
*   A certification issued by a financial institution stating the account number and identification number (foreigner's identification card) for disbursement purposes.
*   One recommendation letter from a university professor.
Timeline:
May 28, 2025 : Application Opening Date
June 13, 2025 : Application Deadline
Up to 6 months : Maximum duration for Perfectioning of Spanish
Up to 18 months (3 academic semesters) : Maximum duration for Specialization
Up to 24 months (4 academic semesters) : Maximum duration for Master's
Up to 48 months (8 academic semesters) : Maximum duration for Doctorate

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Funding Details:
*   Tuition Fees: The RTP Fees Offset covers the full tuition fees for the duration of the scholarship.
*   Stipend (Living Allowance): A tax-exempt living allowance is provided to assist students with their daily expenses. While ScholarshipRoar mentions a maximum monthly stipend of $52,352, this figure appears to be an annual amount, as other universities like Murdoch University specify a tax-exempt living allowance of A$37,000 per annum.
*   Allowances: Additional allowances are provided to assist students with ancillary costs associated with their research degree.
*   Relocation Costs: Some universities, such as UniSC, offer additional support, with RTP Stipend Scholarship recipients having access to a combined total of up to A$2,000 to assist with relocation costs.

Scholarship Duration:
RTP scholarships are available for:
*   A minimum of 3 years and up to a maximum of 4 years for full-time research doctorate students.
*   A minimum of 6 years and up to a maximum of 8 years for part-time research doctorate students.
The exact duration within these ranges is at the discretion of the individual Higher Education Provider (HEP).

Students receiving an RTP scholarship may undertake work outside their graduate research course; however, the duration of the scholarship will not be extended beyond the initial offer period.
Eligibility_Criteria:
The RTP Scholarship is open to both domestic and international students who are undertaking or intend to undertake postgraduate research degrees (Research Doctorate and Research Masters) at eligible Australian universities.
*   Enrollment Status: Applicants must be enrolled in, or have a current offer for admission to, a Higher Degree by Research (HDR) program at an Australian Higher Education Provider. All RTP Scholarship students must maintain enrollment (without suspension) in a current HDR course to receive support.
*   Prior Funding: Candidates must not be receiving an equivalent award or scholarship from the Commonwealth Government that is designed to offset tuition fees or provide a living allowance.
*   Application Process:
    *   New Students: Typically, new applicants select a checkbox to be considered for the RTP scholarship when submitting their postgraduate research degree application.
    *   Current HDR Students: Current HDR students may need to submit a separate scholarship application by the submission deadline. Some universities, like ANU and Macquarie, have specific forms or online portals for current students to apply for scholarship-only consideration.
*   Domestic Students: Domestic students are required to have a Commonwealth Higher Education Student Support Number (CHESSN).
*   Part-time Study: The scholarship is available to students enrolled part-time in a Higher Degree by Research program, particularly for domestic students, and in some cases for international students studying full-time on campus (e.g., Charles Sturt University).
*   University-Specific Criteria: Applicants must satisfy all entry requirements for a higher degree by research at their chosen university and fulfill specific criteria set by that institution. It is crucial to contact the postgraduate research office of the chosen university for detailed information.
Eligible_Fields: All fields
Min_Gpa: Perfect or very close to perfect GPA, often on a maximum 7-point scale
Experience_Years: No specific minimum years of professional experience universally mandated; relevant research experience can be a significant advantage.
Language_Certificate: Mandatory for international applicants (IELTS, TOEFL, PTE); IELTS score of 7 or higher often expected.
Special_Circumstances: Charles Sturt University offers specific AGRTP Indigenous and AGRTP Return to Study scholarships.
Career_Plan: To cultivate graduates equipped with advanced skills for careers in academia and various labor market sectors, contributing to academic advancement and broader societal and economic development.
Other_Requirements:
*   Supervisor Invitation: For some universities (e.g., Curtin University), obtaining an Invitation to Apply from a registered supervisor is a prerequisite.
*   Compliance: All RTP Scholarship recipients and applicants are required to familiarize themselves with university procedures and comply with the Scholarship Conditions of Award and all applicable University policies, including those relating to satisfactory academic progress.
*   Work During Scholarship: Students may undertake work outside their graduate research course, but this will not lead to an extension of the scholarship duration. Universities may also have arrangements for research internships, which might impact RTP stipend rates and duration, potentially requiring a suspension of RTP support during the internship period.
Scholarship_Info: The Australian Government Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarships are a prestigious initiative supporting domestic and international students pursuing postgraduate research degrees in Australia. The program provides flexible funding to eligible Australian Higher Education Providers to train high-quality Higher Degree by Research (HDR) candidates. It aims to cultivate graduates with advanced skills for careers in academia and other sectors, fostering a skilled research workforce contributing to academic advancement and broader societal and economic development.
Application_Documents:
Required documents vary by university but generally include:
*   Academic transcripts
*   Proof of English proficiency
*   A research proposal

For current students:
*   Specific forms (e.g., ANU's 'Request for a current ANU student to be considered for a HDR Scholarship form')
*   Scholarship-only application portals (e.g., Macquarie University)

Some universities (e.g., Monash) automatically consider eligible applicants for all available graduate research scholarships upon course admission application.
Timeline:
July/August (general) : Application periods generally open
2026-07-01 : Murdoch International applications open
2025-08-31 : ANU International Round 1 application deadline
2025-09-30 : StudyAustralia, CDU International application deadline
2026-02-27 : University of Sydney Research Period 3 and 4, 2026 application deadline
2026-06-19 : Charles Sturt University AGRTP International 2027 application deadline
2026-09-30 : Murdoch International application deadline
October/December (general) : Application periods typically close

Scholarship_Name: Swedish Institute Scholarships for Global Professionals (SISGP)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
- Tuition Fees: Full coverage of tuition fees directly to the Swedish university.
- Living Expenses: A monthly stipend of SEK 12,000 (Swedish Kronor) to cover living costs throughout the study period.
- Travel Grant: A one-time travel grant of SEK 10,000 to assist with travel expenses.
- Networking Opportunities: Membership in the SI Network for Future Global Professionals (NFGP), offering valuable professional connections and development opportunities.
- Alumni Network: Lifelong membership in the SI Alumni Network, fostering continued engagement and collaboration among former scholars.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be a citizen of one of the 33 eligible countries (e.g., Armenia, Azerbaijan, Iraq, Jordan, Kenya, Liberia, Ecuador, Egypt, Ethiopia) and be required to pay international tuition fees. Must be admitted to a full-time, one- or two-year master’s program at a Swedish university that is specifically eligible for the SISGP. Applicants should not have previously lived in Sweden for more than two years, must not be currently enrolled in a master's program at a Swedish university, must not have previously been awarded an SI scholarship, and must not hold a degree from a Swedish university. The Swedish Institute welcomes applicants regardless of age or religious beliefs and aims for diversity and gender equality among scholarship holders. Applicants are expected to demonstrate a strong academic background and possess relevant work and leadership experience.
Eligible_Fields: European Studies, Global and International Management, Sustainable Development, Environmental Change and Global Sustainability, Sustainable Cities
Eligible_Field_Group: Humanities & Social Sciences, Economics & Business, Natural Sciences, Agriculture & Environment, Construction & Planning
Experience_Years: Not explicitly stated, but relevant work and leadership experience is emphasized.
Language_Certificate: Typically mandatory for university admission (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL)
Special_Circumstances: Applicants must be required to pay international tuition fees.
Career_Plan: A detailed motivation letter is crucial, explaining how studies will contribute to sustainable development in the home country or globally.
Other_Requirements: Proof of university application fee payment of 900 SEK (Swedish Kronor) is required prior to applying for the scholarship. A valid Passport or National ID is necessary for identification. Two reference letters are required. Proof of Work and Leadership Experience (using SI’s official form). Admission Proof (proof of application to an eligible master’s program).
Scholarship_Info: The Swedish Institute Scholarships for Global Professionals (SISGP) is a highly prestigious and fully funded master’s scholarship program provided by the Swedish Institute (SI). Designed for future global leaders, the scholarship aims to nurture individuals dedicated to advancing sustainable development and driving positive change in their home countries and regions. It offers a unique opportunity to pursue master's level studies in Sweden, replacing the former Swedish Institute Study Scholarships (SISS).
Application_Documents:
- CV (maximum 3 pages)
- Proof of Work and Leadership Experience (using SI’s official form)
- Two Reference Letters
- Passport/National ID
- Motivation Statement/Letter
- Admission Proof (proof of application to an eligible master’s program)
- Proof of university application fee payment (900 SEK).
Timeline:
Mid-November 2025 : SI Scholarship application documents and a list of eligible master's programs are published.
2 February 2026 : Deadline to pay the university application fee (900 SEK) and upload all required documents to University Admissions.
9 February 2026 : The SI Scholarship application portal officially opens.
25 February 2026 : The SI Scholarship application portal closes.
26 March 2026 : Only applicants who have been admitted to an eligible master’s program by this date will be considered for the SI Scholarship for Global Professionals.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
*   Tuition Fees: Full coverage of university tuition fees.
*   Korean Language Training: One year of Korean language training fees, which is a mandatory component unless the scholar is exempt due to high TOPIK proficiency.
*   Airfare: Round-trip airfare to and from South Korea.
*   Monthly Allowance: A monthly stipend designed to cover living expenses.
*   Health Insurance: Comprehensive health insurance coverage.
*   Settlement Allowance: A one-time settlement allowance of 200,000 KRW to assist with initial relocation costs.
Quantity: Undergraduate: ~280 (150 Bachelor's via Embassy Track, 130 Bachelor's/Associate via University Track); Total (Undergraduate & Graduate): ~1,900 for 2026 academic year.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must hold citizenship of an NIIED-designated country invited to participate in the GKS program. Applicants must be in good physical and mental health to pursue studies in Korea. Applicants may apply to only one track (General or R-GKS) within a given application period. Applicants with provisional or temporary graduation certificates are eligible to apply, but must submit official graduation certificate (or diploma) and final academic transcript to the GKS Center, NIIED, by December 31, 2025. There may be restrictions for previous GKS scholars who have received scholarships from GKS Non-degree programs.
Eligible_Fields: All fields of study offered by GKS participating universities are generally eligible, except MBBS program (Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery). Specific examples mentioned include environmental sciences and food-related studies.
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Final Year High School Student
Min_Gpa: 80% on a 100-point scale OR top 20% of class OR 2.68/4.0
Experience_Years: Not required
Language_Certificate: English proficiency (TOEFL, IELTS, Duolingo, General English certificates) required for English-taught programs. Korean proficiency (TOPIK) optional but highly recommended.
Special_Circumstances: Optional documents: Proof of Overseas Korean Document, Proof of Korean Citizenship Renunciation Document, Proof of Korean War Veteran’s Descendant.
Other_Requirements: Reference Letters (FORM 4) required, original sealed letter for 1st round passers. Personal Statement (FORM 2) required. GKS Applicant Agreement (FORM 5) required. Personal Medical Assessment (FORM 6) required. Optional: Copies of awards, other certificates.
Scholarship_Info: The Global Korea Scholarship (GKS), also known as the Korean Government Scholarship Program (KGSP), is a prestigious initiative by the Korean Government, administered by the National Institute for International Education (NIIED). Its primary objective is to provide international students with unparalleled opportunities to pursue higher education in South Korea. This fully funded scholarship aims to attract outstanding students globally, offering them the chance to study in the country for free and experience Korean culture and advanced education.
Application_Documents:
Application Forms:
*   FORM 1 (Application Form)
*   FORM 2 (Personal Statement)
*   FORM 3 (Study Plan)
*   FORM 4 (Recommender’s Information)
*   FORM 5 (GKS Applicant Agreement)
*   FORM 6 (Personal Medical Assessment)

Certificates (Must be Apostilled or Consular Confirmed):
*   Proof of citizenship (applicant and parents) and proof of family relationship.
*   High School Graduation Certificate (or certificate of expected graduation).
*   Academic transcript of high school curriculum.
*   Optional: Graduation certificate (or certificate of expected graduation) of an associate degree program and academic transcript of an associate degree.
Timeline:
2025-09-04 : Announcement Date (2026 Undergraduate Scholarship)
2025-09-15 : Application Opening
2025-10-17 : Embassy Track Deadline (Mail/In-person)
2025-10-31 : Online Application Deadline
Within November 2025 : Second Round Announcement
2025-12-31 : Submission of Official Documents (for provisional graduates)
2026-01-02 : Embassy Track Final University Choice Notification

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
The scholarship primarily covers tuition fees, either fully or partially.
*   Full Scholarship (Master's): RMB 30,000 per year.
*   Partial Scholarship: Can cover half or a quarter of the annual tuition fees.
Eligibility_Criteria: Must be outstanding international students applying for or already admitted to Master's degrees in Chinese universities and colleges located in the Beijing region. Must be admitted as a graduate student at an eligible Beijing university. The duration of the scholarship should be under four years. Must not be receiving other tuition scholarship funds. The scholarship is open to both new applicants and registered self-funded students at eligible universities. Applicants are generally expected to demonstrate excellent academic performance during their undergraduate studies.
Eligible_Fields: Master's degrees across various disciplines offered at eligible Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) in Beijing.
Min_Gpa: Not specified, but excellent academic performance is expected.
Experience_Years: Not required
Language_Certificate: HSK, IELTS, TOEFL
Other_Requirements: Two letters of recommendation, written in Chinese or English, from professors or associate professors are required for graduate programs. Applicants may need to provide a pre-admission document issued by the universities they are applying to. Candidates may need to first apply as self-funded students to their chosen university before applying for the BGS. A Foreigner Physical Examination Form is typically required for visa application purposes.
Scholarship_Info: The Beijing Government Scholarship (BGS) is a prestigious award established by the Beijing Municipal Government to attract and support outstanding international students pursuing higher education and research in China's capital, fostering the development of international higher education in Beijing.
Application_Documents:
Application Form for Beijing Government Scholarship (can be collected from the institutions in Beijing or downloaded from the school’s website of the targeted HEIs).
Two letters of recommendation in Chinese or English from professors or associate professors.
Bachelor’s diploma and degree certificate.
Academic transcripts.
Language proficiency certificates (HSK, IELTS, TOEFL, etc.).
Pre-admission document (if required by the university).
Valid passport copy.
Foreigner Physical Examination Form (for visa application).
