2026-02-08 : Earliest observed application deadline for some online submission systems
2026-02-28 : Common application deadline for 2026-2027 academic year
Approximately three months before study begins : Scholarship Admission Notice, Admission Notice, and Visa Application Form for Study in China (JW201) sent to successful candidates
Annually : Scholarship needs to be applied for and reviewed to ensure continued eligibility

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship comprehensively covers:
*   Full tuition/registration fees
*   A monthly living allowance
*   Insurance coverage
*   International round-trip flight to and from Belgium
*   Visa costs (where applicable)
Quantity: Total: 200 fully funded awards. For Sub-Saharan Africa: 65 for Specialized Bachelor/Master programs, 35 for short training programs.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be permanent residents of and currently working in one of the 31 eligible partner countries. These countries are located across Africa, Southeast Asia, Latin America, and the Middle East. Eligible African countries include Benin, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cameroon, Ethiopia, Guinea, Kenya, Madagascar, Mali, Morocco, Mozambique, Niger, DR Congo, Rwanda, Senegal, South Africa, Tanzania, Tunisia, Uganda, and Zimbabwe.
Eligible_Fields: Master de spécialisation – Design d’innovation sociale, Data Science in Global Health
Eligible_Field_Group: Arts, Design & Media, Social Services & Care, IT & Data Science, Healthcare & Medicine
Experience_Years: at least two years of relevant professional experience. This experience must be acquired after the completion of their graduate studies (Bac+3 for specialized bachelor’s applicants, and Bac+5 for specialized master’s and continuing education students). The relevant professional experience must have been gained in an ARES partner country.
Language_Certificate: Applicants are required to demonstrate proficiency in the language of instruction for their chosen academic or training program. No specific standardized language tests (such as IELTS or TOEFL) are explicitly mandated.
Special_Circumstances: A significant portion of the scholarships (65 for Specialized Bachelor/Master and 35 for short trainings) is specifically earmarked for applicants from Sub-Saharan Africa. Priority is extended to applicants who are working in ARES partner institutions.
Career_Plan: Required, outlined in a motivation letter explaining relevance of chosen program to professional aspirations.
Other_Requirements: Any additional documents specifically requested within the online application form must also be provided.
Scholarship_Info: The ARES International Training Scholarships are a prestigious program offered by the Academy of Research and Higher Education (ARES), an entity of the Belgian government. These scholarships provide fully funded opportunities for international students and professionals to pursue academic and professional training in Belgium. The programs are hosted within higher education institutions of the Wallonia-Brussels Federation. The scholarship aims to support young professionals from eligible partner countries in deepening their expertise through specialized academic training.
Application_Documents:
*   Two recommendation letters (academic and/or professional)
*   Certified copies of original academic and professional documents
*   A detailed CV or résumé
*   A comprehensive motivation letter detailing career goals and program relevance
*   Any other documents specified in the online application form
Timeline: 2025-08-04 : Applications for the 2026-2027 academic year officially opened. Closing date is incomplete, only indicating it "closes on 19".

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Fully funded Master's programmes, offering full financial support.
*   Tuition fees
*   Travel (including overseas travel)
*   Insurance
*   Living expenses (board and lodging)
*   Health insurance
Quantity: A limited number of scholarships are awarded yearly per programme, typically ranging from 8 to 12. For Professional Bachelor programmes: 8 scholarships per programme. For Initial Master programmes: 10 scholarships per programme. For specific Initial Master programmes (e.g., Master of Science in Nutrition and Food Systems, Master of Science in Sustainable Land Management, Master of Science in Tropical Biodiversity and Ecosystems (Mundus tropicalis c/o TROPIMUNDO)): 12 scholarships per programme. For Advanced Master programmes: 10 scholarships per programme.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be from one of the 29 eligible countries in Africa, Asia, and Latin America. Candidates may apply for only one ICP Connect scholarship per year. Applicants may not have previously received a scholarship from the Belgian government to attend a study programme. Furthermore, they must not have been enrolled in a study programme at a Belgian higher education institution before 1 January of the intake year. Preference is given to candidates who have never received a scholarship to study in a higher-income country (for either a bachelor's or master's degree).
Eligible_Fields: Professional Bachelors: Bachelor of Hotel Management, Bachelor of Applied Computer Science. Initial Masters: International Master of Science in Agro- & Environmental Nematology, International Master of Science in Rural Development (IMRD), Master of Aquaculture (IMAQUA), Master of Epidemiology, Master of Science in Food Technology, Master of Science in Marine and Lacustrine Science and Management, Master of Statistics and Data Science, Master in Sustainable Development, Master of Transportation Sciences - Road Safety, Master of Water Resources Engineering (WRE), Master of Science in Nutrition and Food Systems, Master of Science in Sustainable Land Management, Master of Science in Tropical Biodiversity and Ecosystems (Mundus tropicalis c/o TROPIMUNDO). Advanced Masters: Master of Human Settlements, Master of Development Evaluation, Master of Cultural Anthropology and Development Studies, ICP Master in Sustainable Development.
Eligible_Field_Group: Personal Services & Tourism, IT & Data Science, Agriculture & Environment, Natural Sciences, Humanities & Social Sciences, Healthcare & Medicine, Engineering & Technology, Law & Public Policy, Transportation & Logistics, Construction & Planning, Economics & Business, Social Services & Care
Experience_Years: No minimum years of work experience are explicitly stated as a general requirement. However, eligibility may depend on individual circumstances, and some programmes might consider work experience.
Language_Certificate: Proficiency in English is a crucial requirement for programmes taught in English. If an applicant studied in an English-speaking institution, some programmes may waive the English proficiency test requirement. For other programmes, the medium of instruction from a previous degree is generally not accepted as sufficient proof of English proficiency. Minimum scores required in accepted tests (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL) for each programme can be found on the specific programme pages. Test results must be available for online verification.
Age: Candidates for a bachelor's or initial Master's programme cannot be older than 35 as of January 1 of the intake year. Candidates for an advanced Master's programme cannot be older than 45 as of January 1 of the intake year.
Special_Circumstances: Regional balance is considered during the selection process, aiming for a reasonable cross-section of scholars from different countries and regions.
Other_Requirements: Candidates may apply for only one ICP Connect scholarship per year. Only complete submissions will be taken into consideration. Applicants must choose one of the eligible ICP Connect programmes.
Scholarship_Info: The VLIR-UOS ICP Connect Scholarships are a prestigious program offered by the VLIR-UOS (Flemish Interuniversity Council for University Development Cooperation). This initiative aims to support outstanding students from eligible developing countries in Africa, Asia, and Latin America to pursue full-time bachelor's or master's degrees at Flemish higher education institutions in Belgium. The program fosters academic partnerships between Flemish universities and institutions in partner countries, with an overarching ambition to support changemakers who will drive social change in their home countries or regions after completing their studies, addressing global needs for experts in relevant fields.
Application_Documents: While a general list of application documents is not provided, applicants are automatically considered for the ICP Connect Scholarship if they apply for one of the eligible programmes with the required programme-specific documents.
Timeline:
Applications are now open for the 2026/2027 academic year.
2026-01-31 : Application Deadline (23:59 CET)

Funding_Level: Tuition Waiver, Stipend
Funding_Details: The scholarship primarily covers tuition fees for the duration of the chosen program. Scholars receive a monthly stipend of approximately 25,000 Russian Rubles (around 310 USD). Other expenses such as travel, food (beyond what the stipend covers), visa costs, and medical insurance are generally not included and must be borne by the scholarship recipient.
Quantity: More than 12,000 winners historically; 3,700 full scholarships; over 6,300 total scholarships awarded across various cycles.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to foreign citizens and stateless persons, as well as Russian nationals permanently residing abroad (with a residence permit). Applicants from any educational background are encouraged to apply. A minimum GPA of 2.7 is required for all applicants.
Eligible_Fields: All fields
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree, PhD
Experience_Years: For the Postdoc track: At least 5 years of experience in the specialty. Work experience in the field of research declared by the project, availability of copyright certificates for inventions, and publications in highly-ranked journals are considered.
Language_Certificate: Not explicitly required; proficiency in English or Russian is sufficient. Some specific programs or universities might have additional language recommendations.
Age: Bachelor's Degree: 16-23 years old, Master's Degree: 20-33 years old, Doctoral Degree (PhD): Age limits are not specified.
Special_Circumstances: Not mentioned
Other_Requirements: If an applicant is selected as a winner by both the Open Doors Scholarship and the Rossotrudnichestvo scholarship, they must choose between the two; it is not possible to receive both scholarships simultaneously.
Scholarship_Info: The "Open Doors: Russian Scholarship Project" is a prestigious initiative supported by the Russian Government and the Association of Global Universities, designed to attract talented international students to Russia for higher education at leading universities.
Application_Documents: Statement of Purpose/Motivational Letter, Two Letters of Recommendation, Academic Documents (confirming completion of secondary education, Bachelor’s/Specialist’s degree, or PhD/DSc degree), Online Exam/Assessment in the chosen field of study.
Timeline:
2025-09-01 : Opening Date
2025-11-16 : Portfolio Submission Deadline
2025-11-17 – 2025-11-27 : Portfolio Evaluation
2025-12-30 : Announcement of Bachelor's and Master's Track Winners
2026-02-27 : Announcement of Doctoral and Post-doctoral Track Winners

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Covered Expenses Include:
*   Full tuition coverage/fees at selected New Zealand institutions or Pacific universities.
*   Travel expenses (including international airfares).
*   Insurance.
*   Fortnightly living allowance.
*   Monthly stipends (approximately $1,000 USD, equivalent to ~143,000 JPY).
Eligibility_Criteria: Must be a citizen of an eligible developing country. If a country is not on the official list, academic scholarships are not offered. Applicants must be international students. All applicants must complete an online eligibility test to determine their suitability before applying. Scholars are expected to return to their home country after completing their studies to contribute to social and economic development.
Eligible_Fields: Any undergraduate or postgraduate qualification that aligns with the program's development objectives; Specific Short Courses: Good Governance, Sustainable, Resilient and Productive Agri-Food Systems.
Eligible_Field_Group: Law & Public Policy, Economics & Business, Agriculture & Environment, Engineering & Technology, Natural Sciences
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Min_Gpa: Undergraduate: 3.0 or equivalent; Postgraduate: 3.6/4.0 or A to A+ average
Experience_Years: One year of full-time work experience, OR two years of part-time work experience
Min_Working_Hours: 30 hours or more per week for full-time experience
Language_Certificate: Not mentioned
Career_Plan: Scholars are expected to return to their home countries to apply acquired skills and knowledge for social and economic development.
Other_Requirements: Applicants must choose their preferred education institution and preferred courses as part of the application process. There are eleven approved education institutions where Manaaki New Zealand Scholars can study. The application process involves using a Manaaki New Zealand Scholarship Account to access an online application system. It is important to visit country-specific pages on the official website for detailed application information, as the process may differ by country or region.
Scholarship_Info: The Manaaki New Zealand Scholarships, provided by the New Zealand Government, offer a significant opportunity for international students from eligible developing countries to pursue academic and short-term training in New Zealand or at Pacific universities. The program aims to foster sustainable development, reduce poverty, and contribute to a more secure, equitable, and prosperous world by enhancing the mana of partner countries and Aotearoa New Zealand through manaakitanga.
Application_Documents: Online eligibility test, Online application via Manaaki New Zealand Scholarship Account.
Timeline: 1 December 2025 : Application Opening Date (Some short courses); 1 February 2026 : Application Opening Date (Major academic scholarships); 28 February (for certain programs) : Application Deadline (Some applications may close earlier); 01 April 2026 : Application Deadline (for Semester 2, 2026 intake); Six to ten months from application : Selection Process Timeline

Country: Worldwide (excluding UK, Germany, Sweden, Austria, Denmark, Netherlands, Italy, Norway, Ireland)
Funding_Level: Partial Funding, Tuition Waiver, Stipend
Funding_Details:
Scholarships are awarded on a 50% grant and 50% loan basis. The loan portion must be repaid with a service charge of 5% per annum. For PhD students, scholarships are typically awarded for the first two years of study, after which students are expected to secure funding from alternative sources for the remainder of their doctoral program.
The scholarship comprehensively covers tuition fees and living expenses for the entire duration of the degree course.
The award explicitly does not cover the cost of international travel, clothing, furniture, or living expenses for family members.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Applicants must be eligible nationals residing in one of the selected developing countries where a local Aga Khan Foundation (AKF), Aga Khan Education Services (AKES), or Aga Khan Education Board (AKEB) office exists to process applications and interview candidates. Examples of eligible countries include India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Afghanistan, Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania, and other countries in Asia and Africa.
A crucial criterion is that applicants must have no other means of financing their postgraduate studies.
Applicants must generally be under the age of 30.
The program is designed for "outstanding scholars."
Eligible_Fields: All fields
Experience_Years: Not required
Language_Certificate: Required (e.g., TOEFL/IELTS)
Career_Plan: Applicants are expected to demonstrate a commitment to preparing for employment, primarily within the Aga Khan Development Network (AKDN), upon completion of their studies.
Other_Requirements: Priority is given to requests for Master's level courses. Applications for PhD programmes are considered only in the case of outstanding students who are highly recommended for doctoral studies by their professors and who require a PhD for the fulfillment of their career objectives (e.g., academic or research-oriented roles).
Scholarship_Info: The Aga Khan Foundation’s International Scholarship Programme (AKF ISP) is a key initiative to foster leadership and expertise from developing countries, enabling individuals to pursue advanced studies and contribute to development efforts, particularly within the AKDN.
Application_Documents: Specific application forms are obtained from local AKF/AKES/AKEB offices. The required supporting documents (e.g., academic transcripts, essays, reference letters) would be detailed on these forms.
Timeline:
2026-01-01 : Application forms available from local AKF offices
Early January 2026 : Applications open
2026-03-31 : Application Deadline
June or July : Selection process and interviews

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The OKP scholarship was a fully funded programme, designed to strengthen professionals through education and training. It was a €260 million global development programme. The scholarship was intended to supplement the salary that recipients were expected to continue receiving from their employers during the study period.
Covered expenses included:
*   Tuition costs
*   Travel costs
*   Visa application costs
Eligibility_Criteria:
The OKP scholarship targeted mid-career professionals from 52 to 55 eligible OKP countries, primarily in Asia and Africa.
Key eligibility requirements included:
*   Employment: Applicants must have been working for a government, a secondary or higher vocational or academic education institution, a university, or the private sector.
*   Demonstrated Need: The need for the proposed training had to be clearly demonstrated in the context of the applicant's employing organization.
*   Country Focus: Applications were reviewed based on how well they fit the Dutch embassy's country focus for the applicant's home country.
*   Government Statement: For some countries, a government statement expressing support for the applicant's study was required. Applicants needed to check specific government statement requirements.
*   Return to Home Country: Scholarship holders were expected to return to their home country and employer upon completion of their studies, as the programme's aim could not be achieved otherwise.
Eligible_Fields: Wide range of study options (master’s programmes, short courses, Certificate courses), no specific restrictions beyond eligible courses offered by participating Dutch institutions. Example: MSc in Urban Management & Development.
Min_Gpa: Generally 3.4/4.0, some sources indicated 3.17/4.0 (requirements could vary)
Experience_Years: Minimum of 2 to 3 years of appropriate and relevant post-graduate work experience.
Language_Certificate: Proficiency in English or French required. Certificates demonstrating language skills were in place (e.g., IELTS overall 6.5, TOEFL above 100), but specific requirements could vary.
Career_Plan: Motivation letter required, demonstrating the need for training in the context of the employing organization.
Other_Requirements: Mid-career professional status; Employment in government, secondary/higher vocational/academic education, university, or private sector; Demonstrated need for training in context of employing organization; Alignment with Dutch embassy's country focus; Government statement required for some countries; Expectation to return to home country and employer; Recommendation letters considered; Organizational approval required.
Scholarship_Info: The Orange Knowledge Programme (OKP) was a €260 million global development scholarship initiative, funded by the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs and managed by Nuffic since 2017. It aimed to strengthen mid-career professionals through education and training, offering opportunities to study in the Netherlands or an OKP country.
Application_Documents: Government statement (if applicable), Guidelines and criteria to apply, Scholarships FAQ, Delta application form, Motivation letter, Recommendation letters.
Timeline:
2017 : Programme started
2021-02-28 : Spring deadline (last chance for students to apply at that time)
2022-08-31 to 2022-10-11 : Short course applications opening
2023-02-08 to 2023-03-30 : Round 1 applications for courses starting between 2023-07-24 and 2024-01-31
2023-06-28 to 2023-09-05 : Round 2 applications for courses starting after 2024-02-01
2024-12-31 : Programme concluded and final phase-out of most activities outside Europe

Scholarship_Name: Kazakhstan Government Scholarship (State grants/Bolashak – tham chiếu)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Partial Funding, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship is generally described as a comprehensive package, though some variations exist:
*   Widely described as a fully funded scholarship, covering full tuition fees and providing a monthly allowance for living expenses.
*   However, one source mentions it as a partially funded program.
*   A specific monthly stipend of $100 is mentioned for Bachelor's programs.
*   Covered Expenses:
    *   Full tuition fees for the chosen program.
    *   Monthly allowance/stipend for living expenses.
    *   Assistance with the visa and registration process in Kazakhstan.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to international students, including persons of Kazakh nationality who are not citizens of the Republic of Kazakhstan. Applicants must intend to study for a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree.
Eligible_Fields: All fields
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: Not required
Language_Certificate: For Master's and Doctoral applicants, an international certificate confirming proficiency in a foreign language is required. Examples include IELTS, TOEFL, DSH, DELF, or other equivalent certificates, with respective minimum scores as specified by the program.
Special_Circumstances: Including persons of Kazakh nationality who are not citizens of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
Other_Requirements: Applicants are advised to select a university from the list of participating institutions and access the list of available study programs (Bachelor’s, Master’s, Doctorate) and the language of instruction.
Scholarship_Info: The Kazakhstan Government Scholarship for International Students, offered by the Ministry of Science and Higher Education of the Republic of Kazakhstan, is a significant opportunity for international students to pursue Bachelor's, Master's, and PhD degrees at leading Kazakhstani universities.
Application_Documents:
*   Academic Transcripts and Diplomas: Copy of document on previous level of education with transcript (notarized translation into Kazakh, Russian, or English). Bachelor's and Master's diplomas and transcripts (minimum GPA 3.0/4.0, notarized and translated into Kazakh, Russian, or English).
*   Motivation Letter: A personal statement outlining academic and career goals.
*   Recommendation Letter: One recommendation letter from the educational organization where the applicant studied, or from the employer (in Kazakh, Russian, or English).
*   Medical Certificate: A valid medical certificate.
*   Invitation Letter (Optional for Bachelor's): An invitation letter from a Kazakh university, if available, for Bachelor's degree applicants.
*   Language Proficiency Certificate: An international certificate confirming foreign language proficiency (for Master's and Doctoral applicants).
Timeline:
Applications for the 2025 academic year are open.
2025-05-31 : Application Deadline
2025-07-31 : Announcement of Results

Country: Afghanistan, Albania, Algeria, Azerbaijan, Bahrain, Bangladesh, Benin, Brunei Darussalam, Burkina Faso, Cameroon, Chad, Comoros, Cote d’Ivoire, Djibouti, Egypt, Gabon, Gambia, Guinea, Guinea Bissau, Guyana, Indonesia, Iran, Iraq, Jordan, Kazakhstan, Kuwait, Kyrgyzstan, Lebanon, Libya, Malaysia, Maldives, Mali, Mauritania, Morocco, Mozambique, Niger, Nigeria, Oman, Pakistan, Palestine, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Senegal, Sierra Leone, Somalia, Sudan, Suriname, Syria, Tajikistan, Togo, Tunisia, Turkey, Turkmenistan, Uganda, UK, United Arab Emirates, Uzbekistan, Yemen
Funding_Level: Full scholarship
Funding_Details:
Covered expenses typically include:
*   Monthly stipend commensurate with the cost of living of the country of study. For joint scholarships like the IsDB-QMUL PhD Scholarships, a stipend of £1,030 per month is provided.
*   Tuition fees, subject to IsDB’s approval. Fees for all coursework must be covered within the agreed and approved tuition fees.
*   Cost of medical treatment at university/government hospitals, including medical insurance.
*   Economy class airfare.
*   Living expenses.
*   Books.
End_Date: 2025-04-05 (Undergraduate, Master's, PhD Scholarship Programme), 2025-03-20 (IsDB Turkish Government Scholarship)
Quantity: Up to 10 PhD students per year (for IsDB-QMUL PhD Scholarships). Overall, 19,491 scholarships awarded since inception.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Academically meritorious students and mid-career professionals who are citizens of any of the IsDB member countries or Muslim communities in non-member countries. A core requirement is the commitment of graduates to contribute to the development of their communities and countries through their respective professions.

Specific program eligibility:
*   Scholarship Program for Muslim Communities (SPMC): Academically gifted yet financially constrained Muslim students from Muslim communities in non-member countries.
*   IsDB-ISFD Scholarship Program for LDMCs: Targets students from Least Developed Member Countries (LDMCs) such as Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Benin, Burkina Faso, Djibouti, Gambia, Guinea, Guinea Bissau, Mali, Mauritania, Mozambique, Niger, Senegal, Sierra Leone, Somalia, Sudan, Togo, Uganda, and Yemen.
Eligible_Fields: Medicine, Dentistry, Pharmacy, Nursing, Medical Laboratories, Microbiology, Public Health, Nutrition, Health Services Management, Bio-Medicine, Medical Technology, Biology, Biotechnology, Electrical Engineering, Insulation Technologies, Renewable Energy, Energy Technologies, Civil Engineering, Surveying, Urban Planning, Sanitation, Transportation, Recycling Technologies & Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Chemical Physics, Green Technologies, Industrial Technologies, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, Telecommunication and Electronics, Robotics, Artificial Intelligence, Physical and Numerical Modelling, Marine Studies, Marine Sciences, Biological Sciences, Ecosystems, Water Resources Management, Water Refinement, Product Development and Innovation (related to plastic pollution and micro-plastics), Demography, Statistics, Econometrics, Population Studies, Urban Planning, Economic Geography, Islamic Economics, Islamic Finance, Islamic Banking, Economics, Law, Media and Journalism, Political Sciences, Entrepreneurship, Agriculture
Eligible_Field_Group: Healthcare & Medicine, Natural Sciences, Engineering & Technology, Construction & Planning, IT & Data Science, Agriculture & Environment, Economics & Business, Law & Public Policy, Arts, Design & Media, Humanities & Social Sciences
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree, PhD
Min_Gpa: General: 3.0/4.0; High School: 70%; Undergraduate/Master's: 2.0 CGPA or Second Class/Grade above 'Good'
Experience_Years: 2 years of research experience (for MSP)
Language_Certificate: Optional (IELTS or TOEFL)
Age: General: Under 30; PhD: Up to 35; Post-doctoral (MSP): Up to 40; General MSP: Under 35
Special_Circumstances: The Scholarship Program for Muslim Communities (SPMC) specifically targets academically gifted yet financially constrained Muslim students, aiming to empower Muslim communities in non-member countries.
Career_Plan: Research proposals must be relevant to the applicant's country. Graduates are required to actively participate in the development of their communities and countries through their respective professions, contributing to overall development.
Other_Requirements: Priority is given to Ph.D. applicants who have already secured admission at countries and universities that have established a cooperation agreement with IsDB. Certain expenses are generally not covered, including visa costs, additional travel costs, residence permit fees, educational equipment, family support expenses, separate language training, and extracurricular courses.
Scholarship_Info: The Islamic Development Bank (IsDB) Scholarship Program is a prestigious initiative provided by the Islamic Development Bank (IsDB) itself. It is designed to empower member countries and Muslim communities in non-member countries through education and scientific research. The program supports studies in various countries, with a special focus on "Sustainability Science" and development-related fields. Beyond being a scholarship, it is also a development program, requiring students to play a leading role in assisting the development of their communities and countries after completing their studies.
Application_Documents: Applications must be submitted through the IsDB scholarship online portal. Academic records are a mandatory part of the application. Research proposals must be relevant to the applicant's country. Essential resources, including Scholarship Program Booklets, are available on the website.
